content: वरंडः [वृ-अंडच्] {@--1@} A multitude, group. {@--2@} A pimple or eruption on the face. {@--3@} A veranda. {@--4@} A heap of grass. {@--5@} The string of a fish-hook. {@--6@} pocket. (The word वरंडलंबुक in यदिदानीमहं वरंडलंबुक इव दूरमुत्क्षिप्य पातितः <ls>Mk. 1.</ls> is of doubtful meaning; it seems to mean ‘an over-hanging or projecting wall’, which, if raised high, is sure to topple down; so in the case of the Sūtradhāra whose expectations were raised very high only to be cruelly disappointed).
